title: Sodium-ion batteries are set to spark a renewable energy revolution - and Australia must be ready
content: Energy storage collects excess energy generated by renewables, stores it then releases it on demand, to help ensure a reliable supply. Such facilities provide either short or long-term (more than 100 hours) storage. At present, lithium-ion batteries are the primary storage technology but are best for short-term storage. Sodium-ion batteries are now almost ready to fill the long-term storage gap.

title: IAC urges automakers towards Auto LPG for lower emissions and costs
content: The IAC urges OEMs like Maruti Suzuki to adopt Auto LPG, which emits 20% less CO2, 60% less diesel, nearly no particulate matter, and is 40% cheaper. Conversion costs INR 30,000. It's a competitive, sustainable option for stricter norms. Globally, 27 million vehicles use Auto LPG, showing significant growth.

title: Tata Technologies partners with Arm to drive innovation in SDVs
content: In this partnership, Tata Technologies will develop a SOAFEE reference architecture stack using Arm's Automotive Enhanced (AE) technologies and Arm Compute Subsystems (CSS) for Automotive. This development will be supported by a cloud-native framework that integrates various DevSecOps and virtual platform solutions, accelerating the time to market for automakers.

title: Jitendra EV announces new upgrades for JMT Model
content: With a starting price of INR 70,000, the JMT model is an economical solution for businesses transitioning to electric vehicles and consumers looking for eco-friendly travel options. The robust design ensures durability and lower maintenance costs, making it ideal for both commercial and residential users. Features include a split rear seat for comfort and a spacious cargo area, making it suitable for delivering food, groceries, dairy products, pharmacy items, and more. It's also a viable option for personal commuting.
